page.title: 16RECREATION - Lydham/More
page.content: Part of Shropshire Hills Area of Out- standing Natural Beauty,{walking, pony {riding, botanising, bird watching}are popular with tourists and residents, also{paddling and bathing}in West Onny river. Cars drive along our quiet roads, and tourists picnic on verges or drive into fields. Heavy through traffic uses the main A488 and A489 to Mid-Wales and Welsh Coast.{Camps}for Scouts, Guides and Pony Clubs are allowed by some landowners; Ramblers' Association and Naturalists' Trusts arrange{guided walks.}Fossils abound in the Pentamerus beds of Silurian {Rocks}from which are built many homes and farm buildings. Collecting fossils is easy - samples can be picked up in fields, gardens and several small dis- used quarries.{Tourism}is attracted by outdoor{recreation}and we enjoy gardening}as a useful pastime.
